relation: Yes very SAFE. The UTEP police keep everyone very safe and secure.
Big campus Greek Life. Lots of involvement. All Greek fraternities are very involved with campus and community activities

There is a club or an organization for almost everything and anything you can think of. So many different groups you can be involved with. what every you have a passion about, there is an club that will fit your needs.
UTEP is a great Bang for the Buck. It will cast less then $5K a semester to attend. There are great and cheap locations to live that are super close to campus. And cheap ways to eat meals
Go to baseball games, football games, movies. There are many free concets on weekly basis.
The BEST. All food in El Paso is top of the line. Its easy to find mom and pop shops also you can dine in a 5 star location
Comfortable, like you have your own apartment. Easy access to life outside of campus
it is very challenging and demanding
Be very pro-active with your own education. No one will hand it to you
The university is very diverse and welcoming. It feels like home and its very safe. The professors are well-rounded and wonder.
pageTitle: The University of Texas at El Paso (UTEP) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {666338=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 486045=Restaurant selection is fantastic. A student can never go hungry. Unless it's a Friday. Nearly everything closes at 3:00 on Fridays, so students better eat early or take lunch for themselves., 485284=UTEP is #1 in student affordability with an average semester cost of less than $2500. It is much more than worth the cost., 446017=Theres an engineering march that goes around but i honestly havent experienced anything unusual...yet., 563631=My tuition was about $2250, which is pretty decent considering I'm an engineering major., 451832=UTEP is known for its engineering program. There is a tradition for engineering students that is near St Patrick's day in which students learn about the history of the university and do chants and walk all over campus. At the end they paint the letter M on the mountains which is for college of mine. UTEP was originally a mining school back in 1914., 5642=UTEP isn't incredibly expensive. I haven't had a problem covering the expenses. I had a grant for 1000 and a loan, and I was covered. The Food Courts are expensive to me, though. I prefer eating out of campus. There's some cool restaurants around UTEP., 247895=The city of El Paso was rated the safest city in the United States in 2010, making this one of the safest Universities in the country.}

textAfterTable: Am enjoying being here Campus life is packed with activities. There are many clubs and events to go to, so it's hard to be bored. Since the community of students isn't that huge, you will be able to meet and connect to many people. I'm a music major, and I've met sooo many students who are majoring in music. There's also a good range of ethnicity here, so you'll meet lots of different people. It's fun that way. Whatever your major is, you'll most likely meet many of those who have the same major as you, and those who don't. Even if El Paso is a small town, there's always something to do, even if it's hanging out at a cool coffee shop, checking out downtown, cheering for the Miners at the Sun Bowl, or going to a concert. :) Am learning a lot For the time that I've spent here (2 semesters), every professor that I've had has a different approach to teaching in their own way, making each class that I've taken stimulate the mind and be interesting. There are some professors here that I've heard of who didn't quite please the students, but if there are any unsatisfying professors here, you will most likely hear of them, since the student community is quite close. Classes also vary in size. Some classes
